title: Prey: cyberbullying's consequences toward victim's mental health and his social life
abstract: This screenplay project focuses on cyberbullying's impacts on its victims, both mentally and physically. The goal is to shed light into this action of crime that is often overlooked, to make a better cyberspace environment, and to raise awareness to the public, especially cyberbullying perpetrators, to stop what they are doing. To do so, this creative thesis uses cyberbullying concept that points out how the cyberspace bullying can trigger paranoia and depression among many other mental disorders. The work is based on theories on paranoia, deperession and cyberbullying itself. From the screenplay, it is shown how the main characters got cyberbullied, and later went from a healthy, hardworking, resilient man to a mentally broken human being as a consequence. By understanding the impacts the act of cyberbullying can have on a personâ€™s life, cyberspace users can be more responsible and refrain themselves from the act of cyberbullying.
subjects: BULLYING--FICTION; CYBERBULLYING-FICTION; MENTAL HEALTH; MOTION PICTURE AUTHORSHIP
